MusicSnippet.name: MusicSnippet
MusicSnippet.description:
Converts the given notes into Howl objects that can be played.
Can do transformations such as transposition and inversion.
Plays the transformed notes in a given/preset style.

params.name: notes
params.description: Array of notes that define the sonority

QuestionGenerator.name: QuestionGenerator
QuestionGenerator.description:
Script that generates a random question. Parameter should
be a list of integers that refer to indeces in the CSV file
over which the user would like to be tested.

SuccessiveMelodicIntervals.name: SuccessiveMelodicIntervals
SuccessiveMelodicIntervals.description: Generates a series of four random twelve-tone notes.

classitems.description: Get/set the global volume for all sounds.
Mute all sounds.
Unmute all sounds.
Handle muting and unmuting globally.
Check for codec support.

iOS will only allow audio to be played after a user interaction.
Attempt to automatically unlock audio on the first user interaction.
Concept from: http://paulbakaus.com/tutorials/html5/web-audio-on-ios/
Load an audio file.
Get/set the URLs to be pulled from to play in this source.

params.name: urls
params.description: Arry of URLs to load from

return.description: Returns self or the current URLs

classitems.description: Play a sound from the current time (0 by default).

params.name: sprite
params.description: (optional) Plays from the specified position in the sound sprite definition.

params.name: callback
params.description: (optional) Returns the unique playback id for this sound instance.

classitems.description: Pause playback and save the current position.
Stop playback and reset to start.
Mute this sound.
Unmute this sound.
Get/set volume of this sound.
Get/set whether to loop the sound.

params.name: loop
params.description: To loop or not to loop, that is the question.

return.description: Returns self or current looping value.

classitems.description: Get/set sound sprite definition.

params.name: offset
params.description: Where to begin playback in milliseconds

params.name: duration
params.description: How long to play in milliseconds

params.name: loop
params.description: (optional) Set true to loop this sprite

return.description: Returns current sprite sheet or self.

classitems.description: Get/set the position of playback.

params.name: pos
params.description: The position to move current playback to.

return.description: Returns self or current playback position.

classitems.description:
Get/set the 3D position of the audio source.
The most common usage is to set the 'x' position
to affect the left/right ear panning. Setting any value higher than
1.0 will begin to decrease the volume of the sound as it moves further away.
NOTE: This only works with Web Audio API, HTML5 Audio playback
will not be affected.

params.name: x
params.description: The x-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

params.name: y
params.description: The y-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

params.name: z
params.description: The z-position of the playback from -1000.0 to 1000.0

return.description: Returns self or the current 3D position: [x, y, z]

classitems.description: Fade a currently playing sound between two volumes.

params.name: from
params.description: The volume to fade from (0.0 to 1.0).

params.name: to
params.description: The volume to fade to (0.0 to 1.0).

params.name: callback
params.description: (optional) Fired when the fade is complete.

classitems.description: [DEPRECATED] Fade in the current sound.
[DEPRECATED] Fade out the current sound and pause when finished.
Get an audio node by ID.
Get the first active audio node.

Get the first inactive audio node.
If there is none, create a new one and add it to the pool.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to call when the audio node is ready.

classitems.description: If there are more than 5 inactive audio nodes in the pool, clear out the rest.
Clear 'onend' timeout before it ends.
Setup the gain node and panner for a Web Audio instance.
Call/set custom events.
Remove a custom event.

Unload and destroy the current Howl object.
This will immediately stop all play instances attached to this sound.
Buffer a sound from URL (or from cache) and decode to audio source (Web Audio API).

params.name: obj
params.description: The Howl object for the sound to load.

params.name: url
params.description: The path to the sound file.

classitems.description: Decode audio data from an array buffer.

params.name: obj
params.description: The Howl object for the sound to load.

params.name: url
params.description: The path to the sound file.

classitems.description: Finishes loading the Web Audio API sound and fires the loaded event

params.name: obj
params.description: The Howl object for the sound to load.

classitems.description: Load the sound back into the buffer source.
Add support for AMD (Asynchronous Module Definition) libraries such as require.js.
Add support for CommonJS libraries such as browserify.
Returns the position of a note in the circle of fifths.
classitems.name: ordinal

classitems.description:
Takes an array of notes and shifts them over by the specified
amount in the circle of fifths. Take care with providing the
amount to shift; you don't want to shift far enough to create
an unused spelling. Since the shift argument must be in fifths,
it is a range that can be easily determined.
classitems.name: transpose

classitems.description:
Reverses the direction of a collection of notes.
To be used for scales and intervals, but NOT chords!
Do this AFTER the octave is set!
classitems.name: reverseDirection

classitems.description:
Reorders the notes so that they are in the specified inversion.
To be used for major triads, minor triads, and 7th chords only!
NEVER to be used for scales, jazz chords, and 20th century chords!!!
classitems.name: setInversion

params.name: number
params.description: between the values 0 and notes.length-1, inclusive

classitems.description:
Calculate the interval between two notes.
Returns the interval as a number of half steps.
classitems.name: calcInterval

classitems.description:
Calculates the span of a collection of notes. Returns an
integer representing the number of half steps between the
lowest note and highest note in the given note collection.
classitems.name: calcSpan

classitems.description:
Sets an octave appropriate for the given span of notes at random.
Does so by appending a number to the end of each String.
DO NOT USE ON A SCALE OR INTERVAL THAT HAS BEEN REVERSED.
PLEASE REVERSE AFTER SETTING THE OCTAVE!!!
Inverted chords are O.K.
classitems.name: setOctave

return.description: notes with octave numbers appended to each

classitems.description:
Generate a random number for the octave in which a note
collection may begin.
classitems.name: genRandomNum

params.name: number
params.description: of places in which the notes will fit

classitems.description: Returns an array of notes in which the gien note collection may begin.
classitems.name: getOctaveLocations

return.description: notes with octave numbers appended to each

classitems.description:
Sets octave numbers in order, given a starting number. Octave number
increments upon ascension from B to C.
classitems.name: setOctaveNumbers

classitems.description: Go up one note name. G will loop back to A.
classitems.name: increment

classitems.description: Go down one note name. A will loop back to G.
classitems.name: decrement

classitems.description: Determines whether two notenames are enharmonically equivalent.
classitems.name: isEnharmonic

classitems.description: Find the amount to shift to get to a particular note.
classitems.name: findShift

classitems.description: Plays the loaded notes with the given style. If style not given, plays the notes quiz style.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Plays the note at the given index in the tempSounds array.
classitems.name: playNote

params.name: i
params.description: Index of the note to be played

params.name: fade
params.description: (Optional) Number of beats to fade out

classitems.description: Plays all notes in tempSounds at the same time.
classitems.name: playBlock

params.name: fade
params.description: (Optional) Number of beats to fade out

classitems.description: Plays all notes in sequence.
classitems.name: playBroken

params.name: fade
params.description: (Optional) Number of beats to fade each note by

classitems.description: Recursive helper for playBroken()
classitems.name: playBrokenHelp

params.name: note
params.description: Index of the note to be played

params.name: fade
params.description: Number of beats to fade each note by

classitems.description: Generates the Howl files to be played.
classitems.name: generate

params.name: user_function
params.description: (Optional) Function to call when the files are loaded

params.name: octave
params.description: (Optional) Octave the first note starts in

classitems.description:
Transposes notes to a given or random key, gives notes a given or random octave,
 and inverts the notes a given or random amount.
classitems.name: TOI

return.description: An array of the notes with octave numbers

classitems.description:
Returns a new string with the proper quality given the inversion. Only use on 
7th chords.
classitems.name: invert7thQuality

classitems.description:
Takes the given notes and converts them into Howl objects with the appropriate
sound files.
classitems.name: loadFiles

params.name: notes
params.description: Array of notes to be loaded

return.description: Array of Howl objects containing the corresponding audio files

classitems.description: Fades all sound out
classitems.name: fadeOut

classitems.description:
Recursive helper function for this.fadeOut.
Have to do this recursively in order to use Howl's fadeOut()'s 
third parameter.
classitems.name: fade

classitems.description: Clears all timeouts (delayed sounds)
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Sets the volume of all files
classitems.name: setVolume

classitems.description: Returns the type and quality
classitems.name: answer

classitems.description: Sets the bpm
classitems.name: setBPM

classitems.description: Convert accidentals to numbers.
classitems.name: toInt

classitems.description:
Compares two notes by pitch. Returns a positive integer if the first note is
higher than the second note, negative integer if the first note is lower
than the second note, and 0 if they are the same note.
classitems.name: compareTo

classitems.description:
Reference array for converting the difference between two ordinal positions
in the circle of fifths to the arbitrary name of an interval.
Calculates the interval between two notes in standard notation.
classitems.name: getInterval

classitems.description: Creates a note a particular interval away from this note.
classitems.name: getNextNote

classitems.description: String representation of a musical note.
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: This script loads the content of data.csv into a global variable, 'data'.
A 2D array containing the contents of the csv file
Builds an array of MusicSnippets
classitems.name: makeMusicSnippets

classitems.description: Picks a random MusicSnippet from the array.
classitems.name: getNextQuestion

classitems.description: Returns the notes as Strings
classitems.name: getNotes

classitems.description: Generates a 4-note 12-tone melody using backtracking.
classitems.name: generateMelody

classitems.description: Create a palette of notes to try based on previous note.
classitems.name: getPalette

classitems.description: Picks a random starting note. Use notes 9 through 25 (GbA#)
classitems.name: getStartingPalette

classitems.description: Seeded shuffle.
Validation rules for successive melodic intervals.
classitems.name: validateSMI

classitems.description: Sort the notes in order from lowest to highest.
classitems.name: sortNotes

classitems.description: Make sure no two notes are repeated.
classitems.name: checkRepeats

return.description: true if valid, false if not

classitems.description: Ensure that the melody does not exceed the span of an octave.
classitems.name: checkSpan

classitems.description: Ensure that the intervals do not occur all in the same direction.
classitems.name: checkDirections

classitems.description: Ensure that any interval is used no more than once.
classitems.name: checkIntervals

classitems.description: Ensure that the melody does not outline a triad or 7th chord.
classitems.name: checkForHarmony

classitems.description: Associative array (object) for converting note names to audio file numbers
